title: Conversion
text: Convert radicals to exponents using the fact that $$\sqrt[n]{y}=y^{\frac{1}{n}}$$.

title: Property
text: Use the property $${\left(a^b\right)}^c=a^{b c}$$ to simplify $${\left({\left(128x^6+128\right)}^4\right)}^{\frac{1}{7}}$$.
speech: Use the property  parentheses a to the b-th  to the c-th is equal to a raised to the b c power  to simplify  parentheses parentheses, 128 x to the sixth, plus 128  to the fourth  raised to the 1 seventh power .

title: Distributive Law
text: Using the distributive law, we can change $${\left(128x^6+128\right)}^{\frac{4}{7}}$$ to $${128}^{\frac{4}{7}} {\left(x^6+1\right)}^{\frac{4}{7}}$$.
speech: Using the distributive law, we can change  parentheses, 128 x to the sixth, plus 128  raised to the 4 sevenths power  to  128 raised to the 4 sevenths power times parentheses, x to the sixth plus 1,  raised to the 4 sevenths power .

to   128 raised to the 4 sevenths power times , x to the sixth plus 1,  raised to the 4 sevenths power

title: Simplification
speech: 128 is equal to 2 to the seventh , so  128 raised to the 4 sevenths power times parentheses, x to the sixth plus 1,  raised to the 4 sevenths power  is equivalent to  parentheses 2 to the seventh  raised to the parentheses 1 seventh  to the fourth power times parentheses, x to the sixth plus 1,  raised to the 4 sevenths power .
